Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates Didier Raoult's statement by stating that he said COVID-19 was created to kill Africans.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any evidence or support for the statement attributed to Didier Raoult.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Didier Raoult made the statement about COVID-19 being created to kill Africans without any proof or verifiable source.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the statement from the Institut Hospitalo-Universitaire de Marseille, which denies that Didier Raoult made any comments on the subject.
Falters at times: The claim falters by attributing the statement to Didier Raoult without any reliable source or confirmation.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the origins of COVID-19, such as the widely accepted theory that it originated from wildlife.
